meanings.definition: A feeling of tiredness and confusion after a long flight across different time zones.
meanings.sent1: After the long journey, I experienced terrible jetlag and couldn't stay awake.
meanings.sent2: She always struggles with jetlag whenever she travels overseas.
meanings.sent3: The jetlag hit me so hard that I accidentally put my shoes in the fridge!
meanings.sent4: The jetlag was like a heavy blanket, weighing me down with exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The jetlag felt like a fog in my mind, making it hard to think clearly.

meanings.definition: To experience the effects of jetlag.
meanings.sent1: I jetlagged for days after that long-haul flight.
meanings.sent2: Traveling across time zones always makes me jetlag.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could jetlag professionally with all his trips.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of jetlag can really disrupt your sleep schedule.
meanings.sent5: I could feel myself starting to jetlag as soon as we landed.

meanings.definition: The disruption of the body's internal clock due to traveling across time zones.
meanings.sent1: Jetlag can really mess up your sleep patterns.
meanings.sent2: The jetlag from the trip to Europe took weeks to recover from.
meanings.sent3: My body's internal clock was so confused by the jetlag that I woke up at midnight thinking it was morning.
meanings.sent4: The jetlag felt like my body was in a different time zone than my mind.
meanings.sent5: The jetlag made me feel like a time traveler, never quite in the right moment.
